Boil-Water Order Continues After Bacteria Found

A boil-water order continues in the Vermont town of Fair Haven after tests last week showed the drinking water was contaminated with bacteria

    NEWSLETTERS

    Receive the latest new-england updates in your inbox

    Privacy policy | More Newsletters

    A boil-water order continues in the Vermont town of Fair Haven after tests last week showed the drinking water was contaminated with bacteria.

    Town officials said Tuesday they are awaiting the results of tests taken Sunday and Monday to see if the water is clean.

    The town was ordered to boil its water on Sept. 25 after coliform bacteria was found in the water system.

    Town officials say tests on Friday showed the water was clean but they are awaiting the results of more recent tests to see if the boil water order can be lifted. Results could be available by Tuesday afternoon.

    Published at 12:00 PM EDT on Sep 30, 2014

Boil water order lifted for Wood Village

Test results came back and the order was lifted around 11 a.m. Tuesday

KOIN 6 News Staff Published: September 29, 2014, 1:52 pm Updated: September 30, 2014, 11:15 am
  • Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window)
  • Click to share on Google+ (Opens in new window)
  • Share on Facebook (Opens in new window)
  • Click to share on Pinterest (Opens in new window)

WOOD VILLAGE, Ore. (KOIN 6) — The City of Wood Village lifted a boil water notice they issued Monday morning.

Officials lifted the boil water notice around 11 a.m. Tuesday after test results came back.

The incident

Officials of the Multnomah County village about 12 miles from Portland said the water pressure dropped below 20 PSI, and issued a notice applicable to the Upper Pressure System in Wood Village, they said.

On their website Monday, officials said the city was performing maintenance on their reservoirs when the well supplying water to that area of the city shut down for about 90 minutes. The well came back online.

State law requires a boil water order to be issued, and test results are expected within 24 hours.

Troutdale water not affected

The City of Troutdale announced Monday afternoon that water within city limits is safe to drink.

“Troutdale supplies all of its own water from its own wells through a self-contained distribution system,” City Recorder Debbie Stickney said. Although Wood Village and Troutdale share what the city called “emergency interties,” those are kept closed, and remain closed now, Stickney said.

Some Troutdale residents received telephone notifications from the Multnomah County Health Department because some Troutdale and Wood Village residents share zip codes. However, those Troudale residents can ignore the notification.

Residents who are unsure whether or not they are affected by the boil water notice can check by referring to their utility bill. If the bill is to paid to the City of Troutdale, the water is safe, Stickley said.

KOIN 6 News will have more information later.

<h1 class="entry-title">Boil order lifted on Mercer Island, school to resume Tuesday</h1>
<div class="entry-meta clearfix">
<span class="posted-time">Posted 8:50 AM, September 29, 2014, by <a class="author url fn" href="http://q13fox.com/author/q13-fox-news-staff/" rel="author" title="Posts by Q13 News Staff">Q13 News Staff</a>, </span><span class="updated-time">Updated at 01:23PM, September 29, 2014</span> </div>
<div class="entry-share">
<div class="sharedaddy sd-sharing-enabled"><div class="robots-nocontent sd-block sd-social sd-social-icon-text sd-sharing"><div class="sd-content"><ul><li class="share-facebook"><a class="share-facebook sd-button share-icon" data-shared="sharing-facebook-132818" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=facebook" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Share on Facebook"><span>Facebook</span></a></li><li class="share-twitter"><a class="share-twitter sd-button share-icon" data-shared="sharing-twitter-132818" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=twitter" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Click to share on Twitter"><span>Twitter</span></a></li><li class="share-reddit"><a class="share-reddit sd-button share-icon" data-shared="" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=reddit" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Click to share on Reddit"><span>Reddit</span></a></li><li class="share-google-plus-1"><a class="share-google-plus-1 sd-button share-icon" data-shared="sharing-google-132818" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=google-plus-1" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Click to share on Google+"><span>Google</span></a></li><li class="share-pinterest"><a class="share-pinterest sd-button share-icon" data-shared="sharing-pinterest-132818" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=pinterest" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Click to share on Pinterest"><span>Pinterest</span></a></li><li class="share-email"><a class="share-email sd-button share-icon" data-shared="" href="http://q13fox.com/2014/09/29/boil-order-lifted-on-mercer-island/?share=email" rel="nofollow" target="_blank" title="Click to email"><span>Email</span></a></li><li class="share-end"></li></ul></div></div></div> </div>

<div class="row">
<div class="span8 span12-tablet border-right">
<img class="print-logo visible-print" src="https://s0.wp.com/wp-content/themes/vip/localtv-2/img/kcpq/logo-gray.png"/>
<div class="article-archived">This is an archived article and the information in the article may be outdated. Please look at the time stamp on the story to see when it was last updated.</div> <article class="post-132818 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-news" id="post-132818">
<div class="entry-content">
<div class="wp-caption aligncenter" id="attachment_132893" style="max-width: 780px"><a href="https://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all"><img alt="KCPQ-TV" class="size-full wp-image-132893" height="575" sizes="(max-width: 770px) 100vw, 770px" src="http://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=770&h=575" srcset="http://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=770&h=575 770w, http://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=150&h=112 150w, http://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg?quality=85&strip=all&w=300&h=224 300w, http://tribkcpq.files.wordpress.com/2014/09/boil-order.jpg 960w" width="770"/></a><p class="wp-caption-text">KCPQ-TV</p></div>
<p>MERCER ISLAND, Wash — A boil order for Mercer Island was lifted Monday morning after a weekend E. Coli scare.</p>
<p>City officials said water samples collected Saturday had been analyzed and were clear of E Coli.</p>
<p>Authorities said restaurants may reopen following a step-by-step process including flushing their pipes.</p>
<p>“We are gratified to bring this potentially serious incident to an end, and we thank all residents for their sacrifices and food-service establishments for their willingness to cooperate for the health of the community,” said City Manager Noel Treat in a written statement.</p>
<p>Residents are being asked to follow these steps:</p>
<blockquote><p>– Flush pipes at home for 5 minutes by running the cold water tap at all faucets until it feels a lot colder; for a residence with multiple levels, start at the top of the house<br/>
-If discolored, run water until it is clear<br/>
-Follow manufacturer’s instructions for appliances such as water filters and water softeners<br/>
-Dispose of all ice from icemakers, make a new batch, and discard that, then wash and sanitize<br/>
ice trays.</p></blockquote>
<p>The boil advisory was issued Saturday afternoon after routine tests came back positive for E Coli.</p>
<p>School was closed Monday due to the advisory. Many store shelves were also bare of fresh produce and bottled water.</p>
<p>Inspectors were expected to begin inspecting restaurants Monday morning.</p>
<div class="embed-twitter">
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" width="550">
<p>City manager says no one has gotten sick. Tests from Mercer Island reservoirs came back clean. <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/Q13FOX?src=hash">#Q13FOX</a></p>
<p>— Tom Yazwinski Q13Fox (@TomYazwinski) <a href="https://twitter.com/TomYazwinski/status/516634485094621184">September 29, 2014</a></p></blockquote>
<p><script async="" charset="utf-8" src="//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script></p></div>
<div class="embed-twitter">
<blockquote class="twitter-tweet" width="550">

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>Drinking water from several roadside springs across the four-county region could pose health risks, an official indicated this week, after tests revealed the presence of bacteria.</p><p>A Penn State Extension Office official is continuing to sample a site in McKean County, and Penn State law students have been called in to determine if local government would be held liable should Elk County residents become ill after drinking contaminated water.</p><p>Last year, a majority of 35 roadside springs across 19 counties in the state tested positive for the presence of Coliform bacteria and less than half tested for E. coli, said James Clark, who is a water resources educator of the McKean County Penn State Extension Office. This year, officials with the office are re-testing eight of those locations, one of them between Port Allegany and Coudersport.</p>
<div data-tnt-ads-tmp='{"vendor":"blox","type":"region","region":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","id":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset","pos":"fixed-big-ad-top-asset, atf","fold":"above","include_domain":null,"size":"[300,250]","height":"250","width":"300","mobile":false,"js":{"video":"https:\/\/bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com\/bradfordera.com\/shared-content\/art\/tncms\/templates\/libraries\/flex\/components\/video\/resources\/scripts\/video.512a6903eae08e033c76afdce2a0eac7.js"},"overline":null,"index_slug":null,"url":"\/"}' style="display:none;"></div>
<div data-refreshable="true" data-region="fixed-big-ad-top-asset"><div class="tncms-region-ads" id="tncms-region-ads-fixed-big-ad-top-asset">
<div id="blox-ad-position-fixed-big-ad-top-asset1">

</div>
</div>
</div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>“Lots of people use roadside springs as a drinking water source. Yet they’re never tested,” he said, adding that the sites aren’t treated, either.</p><p>Coliform bacteria indicates the possible presence of disease-causing bacteria in the water. E. coli is a type of fecal Coliform bacteria often found in the intestines of animals and humans, a sign that that human or animal waste is entering the water supply.</p><p>“E. coli raises more health concerns,” Clark said.</p><p>Unfortunately, it’s a mystery as to how many people use roadside springs as a drinking water resource, but officials want to educate people about boiling water or having the roadside springs tested.</p><p>Clark said people can develop an immunity to the bacteria, but offering somebody water with bacteria could prove to be bad news. The individual could fall ill.</p><p>The quality of roadside springs is ever-changing, Clark said. One day the water could be clean and the next day could be different. And, that’s what officials want to find out: water quality over a period of time, Clark indicated.</p><p>A drinking resource between Coudersport and Port Allegany in McKean County is being re-tested throughout the year. </p><p>Clark said he recently re-tested the roadside spring this month, and he is hoping to take another sample in November. He wants to do four tests this year.</p><p>In Fox Township, Penn State University law students will examine the liability of the roadside spring on Four Points Road, and the findings will be shared with township supervisors. One of the questions could be whether sign should be placed at the roadside spring. Clark said that the hope is that the work will be completed by the spring.</p>

<div class="card-body">
<div class="card-headline">
<h4 class="">
<a href="/news/business/in-revamped-jeep-wrangler-big-changes-are-beneath-the-skin/article_10ac5e7e-cc0c-5648-855c-0b3f56e9daed.html">
        

        
        In revamped Jeep Wrangler, big changes are beneath the skin</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>
</article>
</div>
<div class="clearfix hidden-xs"></div>
<div class="clearfix hidden-xs"></div>
</div>
</div>
</section>
</div></div><p>Clark conducted testing at roadside springs in McKean, Potter, Cameron and Elk counties and more often than not he found they had traces of Coliform bacteria.</p><p>In McKean County, a roadside spring tested positive for Coliform bacteria at Taintor Road in Lafayette Township. Two Mile Road in the Port Allegany area tested positive for Coliform bacteria and E. Coli, and a Route 59 roadside spring came back negative. A roadside spring near the Cow Palace in Limestone, N.Y. state tested negative.</p><p>Meanwhile, Potter County springs on Dingman Road in Coudersport and on Route 49 near Coudersport came back positive for Coliform bacteria.</p><p>In Cameron County, a test of a roadside spring along the Railroad Avenue Second Switchback resulted in the presence of Coliform bacteria and E. coli. Other springs in that county also tested positive for Coliform bacteria.</p><p>In Elk County, a roadside spring along Route 949 in Ridgway, resulted in no Coliform bacteria and no E. coli; but, a spring along state Route 3002 in the Ridgway area showed the presence of Coliform bacteria. A spring on Four Points Road in Fox Township tested positive for Coliform bacteria and E. coli.</p><p>Of the 35 roadside springs tested throughout Pennsylvania between April 3 and Aug. 12, 2013, 91 percent did not meet Coliform bacteria standards and 34 percent not meet E. coli standards, according to Clark.</p><p>As part of the water education, surveys are also being handed out to residents that includes the usage of roadside springs. Some people feel that roadside springs are more natural, and they do not like the taste of chlorine in public drinking water, Clark said.</p>

        });

<script>
            $(window).load(function() {

                var bizTracked = [];
                var isUserAction = false;

                function trackActive(owl){
                    if( bizTracked.length == 10 ){
                        return;
                    }else{
                        var activeThings = $(owl).find('.owl-item.active');

                        $.each(activeThings, function(index, value){
                            var bizId = $(this).find('.card').data('bizid');
                            var hasBeenLogged = false;

                            bizTracked.forEach(function (item, index, array) {
                                if(item == bizId){
                                    hasBeenLogged = true;
                                    return true;
                                }
                            });
                            if( hasBeenLogged == false ){
                                bizTracked.push(bizId);
                                TNCMS.Tracking.addEvent({
                                    app: 'business',
                                    metric: 'block',
                                    id: bizId
                                });
                            }
                        });
                    }
                }

                window.card_carousel_1270448 = $('#block-1270448 .owl-carousel');

                

                card_carousel_1270448.owlCarousel({
                    loop:true,
                    margin:15,
                    nav:false,
                    dots:false,
                    slideBy: 'page',
                    autoHeight:false,
                    
                        autoplay: true,
                        autoplayHoverPause: true, 
                        autoplayTimeout: 5000,
                    
                    responsiveClass:true,
                    responsive:{
                        0:{
                            items:1,
                            stagePadding: 40,
                            nav:false
                        },
                        600:{
                            items:4
                        },
                        1000:{
                            items:2
                        }
                    }
                });

                // bind previous click
                $('#block-1270448 .owl-carousel-control.prev').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1270448.trigger('prev.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind next click
                $('#block-1270448 .owl-carousel-control.next').on(__tnt.client.clickEvent, function(e){
                    e.stopPropagation();
                    card_carousel_1270448.trigger('next.owl.carousel');

                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind dragged
                card_carousel_1270448.on('dragged.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    isUserAction = true;
                    
                });

                // bind translated
                card_carousel_1270448.on('translated.owl.carousel', function(event){
                    if( isUserAction ){
                        trackActive(card_carousel_1270448);
                        isUserAction = false;
                    }
                });
            });
        </script>

<li><figure class="photo layout-square">

<a href="/sports/national/the-series-of-flagrant-violations-for-which-you-are-being/image_abefbceb-3736-5c10-8b14-dd270b2560b0.html">
<img alt=""The series of flagrant violations for which you are being disciplined began with 12:31 remaining in the first quarter – less than three minutes into the game, wrote NFL VP of football operations Jon Runyan in a letter to Crabtree.  

"First, you punched a Broncos opponent Chris Harris in the midsection, resulting in him being removed from the game.  Then, on the subsequent play, you blocked a different Broncos opponent (Aqib Talib) into the sidelines beyond the yellow media border, well after the play was over.  Your actions triggered a melee and endangered various sideline and League personnel, including one of our Game Officials who was injured trying to maintain control of the situation.  Finally, during the ensuing altercation, you grabbed and twisted that same opponent's facemask and threw a punch at him…Such actions have no place in this game, engender ill will between teams, and lead to further confrontations."

In a separate letter to Talib, Runyan wrote, "The series of flagrant violations for which you are being disciplined began less than three minutes into the game.  

“First, while competing on the field of play, you deliberately ripped your opponent's chain from his neck just as you did last year when you played against him.  Then, when the two of you went to the ground after a subsequent play, you aggressively removed his helmet and threw it in his direction, endangering him and various sideline personnel in the near vicinity. Finally, once you were momentarily separated from your opponent, you again engaged him and threw a punch…Such actions have no place in this game, engender ill will between teams, and lead to further confrontations."" class="img-responsive lazyload full" data-sizes="auto" data-srcset="https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/bradfordera.com/content/tncms/assets/v3/editorial/a/be/abefbceb-3736-5c10-8b14-dd270b2560b0/5a1b523a55f1c.image.jpg?crop=731%2C731%2C146%2C0&resize=100%2C100&order=crop%2Cresize 100w" height="731" src="data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAAEAAAABCAQAAAC1HAwCAAAAC0lEQVR42mM8Uw8AAh0BTZud3BwAAAAASUVORK5CYII=" width="731"/>

<script>
	var user_log_state = 0;
  var user_log_drop_state = 0;
  $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-link").mouseover(function() {
    $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("display", "block");
    $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("opacity", 1);
    user_log_state = 1;
  });
  $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-link").mouseleave(function() {
    user_log_state = 0;
      setTimeout(function(){
        if(user_log_state === 0 && user_log_drop_state === 0 ){
          $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("display", "none");
        $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("opacity", 0);
        }
      },500); 
      
  });
  $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").mouseleave(function() {
    $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("display", "none");
    $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").css("opacity", 0);
    user_log_drop_state = 0;
  });
  $(".site-nav-item .site-nav-user-dropdown").mouseover(function() {
    user_log_drop_state = 1;
  });
	
	$(".site-nav-user-dropdown .site-nav-user-login-btn.site-nav-user-login-facebook-btn").click(function() {
		logIn();

	$(".site-nav-user-dropdown .site-nav-user-logout-btn").click(function() {
		logOut();
	});
  </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
  (function ($, list){
    var ajaxUrl = $(".site-nav-list").eq(0).attr('ajaxurl');
	var domain = window.location.host;
    var overSupernav = false;
    var mousehover;
    var theTimer;
    var itemArray = list.substring(1).split(",");
    var haveMenu = {};
    var z = itemArray.length - 1;
    for(; z > -1; z--) {
        haveMenu[itemArray[z]] = [false,false];/*first parameter is used to judge if the nav item have load the ajax html dom node, the second parameter is used to judge if the nav item  have sent the ajax url request*/
    };
    
    $(".supernav").mouseleave(function(){ 
        allInvis(); 
    }).mouseenter(function(){ 
        overSupernav = true; 
    });

    function bindSuperNavEvent(filterSubClassString) {
        $(filterSubClassString).mouseenter(function(){ 
            overSupernav = true; 
        });
    
        $(filterSubClassString).mouseleave(function(){ 
            allInvis(); 
        });
    };
    
    function checkForIt(){
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        theTimer = setInterval(function(){ 
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        if(overSupernav == false){ 
        allInvis(); 
        } 
        }, 1000);
        
    };
    
    var allInvis = function(){
        overSupernav = false;
        clearInterval(theTimer);
        var theSupernav = $(".supernav");
        theSupernav.addClass("supernav-vis");
        for(var t = 0; t < itemArray.length; t++){
            var finderClassString = ".site-nav-"+itemArray[t]+"-link";
             if (itemArray[t] == "local") {
                $(finderClassString).removeClass("teg-gen");
            } else {
                $(finderClassString).removeClass("teg-" + itemArray[t])
            }
        }
    };
    
    var handleHoverEvent = function(i,flag) {
        (function(index){
            var finderClassString = ".site-nav-"+itemArray[index]+"-link";
            var finderSubClassString = "."+itemArray[index]+"-supernav";
            $(finderClassString).mouseover(function(){
                mousehover = this;
                var self = this;
                var preAjaxUrl = ajaxUrl;
                var friendlyURL = $(this).attr('friendlyURL');
                 var url = "http://"+ domain + preAjaxUrl.replace("frendlyUrl_place_holder", friendlyURL).replace("module_instance_id_place_holder","MOD-NAVIGAION-HEADLINE-LIST");
                if(friendlyURL != null && haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0] == false && haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] == false) {
                    haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] = true;
                    $.ajax({
                            type: "GET",
                            url: url,
                            current:self,
                            success:function(html){
                                $("header.site-header").eq(0).after(html.trim());
                                haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0] = true;
                                bindSuperNavEvent(finderSubClassString);
                                if(flag) {
                                    $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-gen"); 
                                } else {
                                    $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-"+itemArray[index]);
                                }
                                if(self == mousehover) {
                                    allInvis();
                                    $(finderSubClassString).removeClass("supernav-vis");
                                }
                            },
                            error:function(){
                                haveMenu[itemArray[index]][1] = false;
                            }
                        });
                } else if(haveMenu[itemArray[index]][0]) {
                    allInvis(); 
                    if(flag) {
                        $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-gen"); 
                    } else {
                        $(finderClassString).addClass("teg-"+itemArray[index]);
                    }
                    $(finderSubClassString).removeClass("supernav-vis");
                };
            });
                
            $(finderClassString).mouseout(function(){
                mousehover = null;
                checkForIt();
            });
        })(i);
    };
    
    (function(){
      for(var i = 0; i< itemArray.length; i++){
        if (itemArray[i] == "local") {
            handleHoverEvent(i,true);
        } else {
            handleHoverEvent(i,false);
        }
      }
    })();
	

    /* Bind touch events so menu is usable on tablets */
    var siteNavLinkString = '.site-nav-link.site-nav-text-link',
        siteNavString = '.site-nav,.supernav',
        pageBody = $('body'),
        pageNav = $('nav.site-nav');

    function onNavClick(event) {
        event.preventDefault();
    }

    function onNavTouchEnd(event) {
        pageNav.data('nav-open', event.target);
        pageBody.on('touchend', onBodyTouchEnd);
    }

    function onNavTouchStart(event) {
        /* Simulate click behavior if this nav has been tapped once before */
        if (pageNav.data('nav-open') == event.target) {
            window.location.href = event.currentTarget.href;
        }
        /* Disable click event */
        if (pageNav.data('click-bound') != true) {
            pageNav.on('click', siteNavLinkString, onNavClick)
            pageNav.data('click-bound', true);
        }
        pageNav.data('nav-open', null);
    }

    function onBodyTouchEnd(event) {
        var $target = $(event.target);
        if ($target.not(siteNavString) && $target.parents(siteNavString).length === 0) {
            pageBody.off('touchend', onBodyTouchEnd);
            pageNav.data('nav-open', null);
            allInvis();
        }
    }
    pageNav.on('touchstart', siteNavLinkString, onNavTouchStart)
        .on('touchend', siteNavLinkString, onNavTouchEnd);
    /* end touch events section */
            
    
  })(jQuery, ',weather,local,traffic,sports,features,about');

</script>

<section class="storytopbar-bucket story-headline-module">
<h1 class="asset-headline" itemprop="headline">Mercer Island schools closed on Monday</h1>
</section>
<!-- story top video -->
<!-- story create time -->
<section class="storytopbar-bucket story-byline-module">
<div class="asset-metabar">
<span class="asset-metabar-author asset-metabar-item" itemprop="name">KING Staff  and  KING5.com , KING</span>

</div>
</section>
<!-- story body -->
<div class="asset-double-wide double-wide p402_premium" itemprop="articleBody" role="main">
<div class="story-asset story-metadata-asset">
<div class="article-metadata-wrap">

<span class="toggle"></span>
<meta content="" itemprop="name"/>
<p class="image-credit-wrap">
<span class="js-caption-wrapper">
<span class="cutline js-caption">Part of the produce section of Mercer Island QFC was lined with caution tape after news of E Coli came out.</span>
<meta content="" itemprop="copyrightHolder"/>
<span class="credit">(Photo: KING)</span>
</span>
</p>

<img alt="" class="expand-img-horiz" data-mycapture-src="http://www.king5.com/img/resize/content.king5.com/photo/2014/09/28/1411936099000-0927boil-water-MI_3029108_ver1.0.jpg?preset=534-401" itemprop="url" src="http://www.king5.com/img/resize/content.king5.com/photo/2014/09/28/1411936099000-0927boil-water-MI_3029108_ver1.0.jpg?preset=534-401"/>

<p></p><p>Schools in the Mercer Island district will be closed Monday because of a boil water order. That includes all before- and after-school activities on school grounds.</p><p><span>Residents on Saturday were advised to boil their water before drinking and all restaurants were ordered to close because of the presence of E. coli in the water supply, the city said.</span><br/></p><p><span>On Sunday the city said water samples were on an "improving trend," and the next test results would be available Monday. If the samples are clean the alert will be over.</span></p><p><span>The City said the water provider, Seattle Public Utilities </span><span>routinely tests over 800 samples for bacteria from the region each month, including 18 samples collected each month in the Mercer Island distribution system.</span></p><p><span>Test samples collected on Mercer Island on Friday showed the presence of E. coli, indicating that the water may not be safe to drink.</span></p><p>The city said utility was inspecting system facilities, flushing water mains in potential problem areas and ensuring chlorine levels were adequate throughout the distribution system.</p><p>Sixty-two restaurants and grocery stores were impacted.</p><p>The city issued the following guidelines:</p><p>- Boiled or purchased bottled water should be used for drinking, making ice, brushing teeth, and food preparation until further notice. Bring the water to a boil, let it boil for at least 1 minute, and let it cool before using. Boiling kills bacteria and other organisms that could potentially be in the water. </p><p>- Dishwashers can be used if run with the sanitizing/heat cycle and commercial dishwashing detergent. Dishes can be hand washed if rinsed in a diluted bleach solution – one teaspoon household bleach to one gallon of water – and then allowed to air dry. </p><p>- Water can be used for bathing, but do not drink any of the water and do not allow babies to put the water or wet washcloth in the mouth. </p><p>The city said the problem is isolated to Mercer Island. </p><p>No illness has been reported. Anyone with diarrhea, cramps, nausea, headaches, or other symptoms may want to seek medical advice, the city said.</p><p>Residents can call the City of Mercer Island hotline at 206-275-7800 or visit <b><a href="http://www.mercergov.org" title="http://www.mercergov.org/">www.mercergov.org</a></b></p> <div> <div class="story-asset inline-share-tools-asset mod-wrapper"> <div Boil Water Advisory Issued for RWD No. 1 in Marion Co.

Thursday
Sep 25, 2014 at 11:03 AM

The Kansas Department of Health and Environment has issued a boil water advisory for the Rural Water District No. 1 public water supply located in Marion County. KDHE officials issued the advisory because of a loss of pressure. Failure to maintain adequate pressure may result in a loss of chlorine residuals and bacterial contamination.
The advisory took effect on Sept. 24 and will remain in effect until pressure is restored and all other conditions which place the system at risk of contamination are deemed by KDHE officials to be adequately resolved.
Customers should observe the following precautions until further notice:

Boil water for one minute prior to drinking or food preparation, or use bottled water. Dispose of ice cubes and do not use ice from a household automatic icemaker. Disinfect dishes and other food contact surfaces by immersion for at least one minute in clean tap water that contains one teaspoon of unscented household bleach per gallon of water. Water used for bathing does not generally need to be boiled. Supervision of children is necessary while bathing so that water is not ingested. Persons with cuts or severe rashes may wish to consult their physicians. If your tap water appears dirty, flush the water lines by letting the water run until it clears. Public water suppliers in Kansas take all measures necessary to notify customers quickly after a system failure. Regardless of whether it’s the supplier or KDHE that announces a boil water advisory, KDHE will issue the rescind order following testing at a certified laboratory.

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>PLATTSBURGH — The Clinton County Health Department has issued a boil-water order for Town of Plattsburgh customers in the PARC Water District, formerly known as the New Base.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>The system lost pressure due to a water-main break at the intersection of New York Road and Northern Avenue.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block visible-xs" id="tncms-block-1108091">
<!-- Mobile Rectangle ATF 300x250 article -->
<div class="visible-xs visible-sm" id="mobileRectangle_atf" style="width:100%;text-align:center">
<script type="text/javascript">
AdBridg.cmd.push(function() { AdBridg.display('mobileRectangle_atf'); });
</script>
</div>
<div class="clear" style="padding-bottom:10px"></div>
</div></div>
<p>For more information, call the Health Department at 565-4870.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

            var bloxServiceVerified = $.cookie('tncms-services-verified');

            if( bloxServiceVerified != 1 ){
                var bloxServiceIDs = [];
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5611);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4534);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4535);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(4540);
                
                    bloxServiceIDs.push(5331);
                
                if (__tnt.user.services){
                    var bloxUserServiceIDs = __tnt.user.services.replace('%2C',',').split(',');
                    $.each(bloxUserServiceIDs, function(index, value){
                        var serviceID = parseInt(value);
                        if( serviceID != 0 ){
                            if( $.inArray(serviceID, bloxServiceIDs) > -1 ){
                                bloxHasSubscription = true;
                                return false;
                            }
                        }else{
                            bloxHasSubscription = true;
                            return false;
                        }
                    });
                }
            /* service has been whitelisted */
            } else {
                bloxHasSubscription = true;
            }

            /* check for whitelists once per day */
            if( !bloxHasSubscription && !bloxServiceVerified && typeof userWhiteList != 'undefined' && $.isArray(userWhiteList) ) {
                $.getJSON("http://magicvalley.com/_services/v1/client_ip_info",function(data){
                    /* create a range */
                    var dataRange = data.ip.split('.');
                    dataRange = dataRange[0]+'.'+dataRange[1]+'.'+dataRange[2];
                    if( jQuery.inArray(data.ip, userWhiteList) > -1 || jQuery.inArray(dataRange, userWhiteList) > -1 ){
                        /* white list machine */
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 1, { path:'/' });

                        bloxHasSubscription = true;
                    } else {
                        $.cookie('tncms-service-validated', 0, { path:'/', expires:1 });
                        
                        __tnt.metering.check();
                    }
                });

            /* no access */
            }else if( !bloxHasSubscription ){
                __tnt.metering.check();
            }
            
            if(bloxHasSubscription){
                $('.subscriber-only.encrypted-content').each(function(){
                    $(this).html(tncms.unscramble($(this).text()));
                    $(this).show();
                });
                $('.subscriber-hide').show();
            }

            // show main content div
            $('#site-container').show();

            // hide loading spinner
            $('.subscriber-load').hide();
        });

<span class="caption-text">
<p>DREW NASH • TIMES-NEWS City water employees set up pumps to suck the water out as crews work to repair a major water line break Monday, Sept. 22, 2014, at the intersection of Orchard Drive and Washington Street South in Twin Falls.</p>

<div class="asset-content p402_premium subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<div class="subscriber-preview"><p>TWIN FALLS • A boil water order was lifted Tuesday morning for southern Twin Falls, but some homes and businesses still didn’t have water service.</p></div><div class="subscriber-preview"><p>City crews worked through the night Monday to repair a major water-line break, and water tests came back clean.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>A 24-inch pipe had ruptured Monday morning near Washington Street South and Orchard Drive.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-top, atf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-top-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The boil order affected homes and businesses south of Park Avenue to Orchard Drive, and west of Harrison Street South to Washington Street South.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Nine homes and two businesses still didn’t have any water service as of Tuesday afternoon.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city provided hotel accommodations to affected residents Monday night, city spokesman Josh Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Residents were concerned about water quality, as well as construction noise, he said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The city’s insurer, Idaho Counties Risk Management Program, paid for the hotel rooms. The city also provided vouchers Monday for affected residents and merchants to get free drinking water at Swensen’s Markets.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Work continued Tuesday at Washington and Orchard Drive, and the intersection remained closed.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center "><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-inline-video, stf" data-dfp-size="[4,1]" data-lazy="true" id="fixed-inline-video" style="min-height:1px; min-width:4px;"></div></div>
<div class="subscriber-only"><p>“We are still expecting it to be a couple of days before the intersection is fully opened,” Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>If possible, city crews may provide traffic control in the area, he said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Motorists still have access to nearby businesses, such as the Oasis Stop ‘N Go, Swensen’s Markets and Family Dollar Store. Signs will direct motorists how to reach those businesses.</p></div><div class="tnt-ads-container text-center hidden-sm hidden-md hidden-lg"><div class="tnt-ads dfp-ad" data-dfp-adunit="/8438/magicvalley.com/news/local" data-dfp-custom-pos="fixed-big-ad-middle, stf" data-dfp-size="[300,250]" id="fixed-big-ad-middle-mobile" style="min-height:250px; min-width:300px;"></div></div>
<div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block" id="tncms-block-1415766">

</div></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>City crews are tearing up the damaged asphalt, “a pretty significant process,” Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The broken pipe, which is only 2 years old, is part of a system that supplies one of the city’s main water mixing stations.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>The cause of the break still hadn’t been determined, Palmer said.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Another underground water pipe broke Sept. 16 on Harrison Street, prompting a water outage at Harrison Elementary School and the nearby Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Harrison students were told they could bring bottled water to school, and bottled water was provided to them.</p></div><div class="subscriber-only"><p>Water service was restored by the next morning.</p></div><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 80;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 80) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 80);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<div class="infinity-summary-container hidden-print" id="infinite-container">
<div data-next-url="http://magicvalley.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=8e0f3ea8-439d-11e4-aed3-97e082e2ccd0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube" id="infinite-more">
<i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i>
</div>
</div>
<script>
        
            var bFoundOrigin = true;
            var sOriginID = null;
        
        var sOriginURL = scrubURL('http://magicvalley.com/tncms/search/mlt/?origin=8e0f3ea8-439d-11e4-aed3-97e082e2ccd0&app=editorial&inline=infinity&type=article%2Ccollection%2Cvideo%2Cyoutube'); // original url scrubbed for preview
        var sFirstID = null;
        var bFirstRun = true;
        var bShowAd = true;
        var bInfiniStop = false;

        function populateInfinitySet(sURL) {
            sURL = scrubURL(sURL);

            // Until the origin paramter for cms.search.mlt functions, we have to start/stop the looping on our own
            // This will require not displaying any assets until we hit oAsset.
            // Then we loop through and display until we've been through everything up to our origin

            $.ajax(sURL).then(function(oResponse, sStatus, oXHR) {

                var sNextUrl = null;

                if (typeof oResponse.next_url == 'undefined') {
                    // URL supplied is no good. Revert to original URL
                    sNextUrl = sOriginURL;
                } else {
                    sNextUrl = scrubURL(oResponse.next_url);
                }

                // Manage response
                if (typeof oResponse.assets != 'undefined' && oResponse.assets.length > 0) {
                    
                    // Remove old more data
                    $("#infinite-more").remove();

                    
                    // Build infinity set
                    $.each(oResponse.assets, function(index) {
                            if (index == 1 && sOriginID == null) {
                                sOriginID = oResponse.assets[0].id;
                            }
                        // Display assets once origin is found
                        if (bFoundOrigin == true) {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                bInfiniStop = true;
                                sNextUrl = null;
                                $("#infinite-more").remove();
                                
                            } else if (bInfiniStop == false && this.id != '8e0f3ea8-439d-11e4-aed3-97e082e2ccd0') {
                                // Display asset
                                var sHTML = '';
                                if (this.content) {
                                    sHTML += '<div class="infinite-item original row"><div class="col-md-8">' + this.content + '</div><div class="col-md-4 text-center">';
                                    if (bShowAd == true) {
                                        // Show advertisement
                                        sHTML += '<div class="infinity-ad empty"></div>'
                                        bShowAd = false;
                                    } else {
                                        bShowAd = true;
                                    }
                                    sHTML += '</div></div><hr>';
                                }
                            }
                        } else {
                            if (this.id == sOriginID) {
                                // Origin found. Begin displaying assets
                                bFoundOrigin = true;
                            } else {
                                // Origin found is false. Skip asset
                                // Fail-safe in case origin is not present in set. This can be removed when origin is fixed.
                                if (bFirstRun == true) {
                                    // Stored first id
                                    sFirstID = this.id;
                                    bFirstRun = false;
                                } else if (this.id == sFirstID) {
                                    // We've started again. Force origin
                                    sOriginID = sFirstID;
                                    bFoundOrigin = true;
                                } // end Fail-safe
                            }
                        }
                        // Append infinity set to container
                        $("#infinite-container").append(sHTML);
                    });

                    // Include block_id on newly added list items
                    $('#infinite-container .infinite-item.original').each(function() {
                        var sHref = scrubURL($(this).find(".card-headline a").attr("href"));
                        
                        // Add to image and headlines links
                        $(this).removeClass('original')
                            .find(".card-headline a, .image a")
                            .attr("href", sHref + "#tncms-source=infinity-scroll-summary-siderail-latest");
                    });

                    // Check next URL
                    if (sNextUrl) {
                        // if origin hasn't been found yet and we hit next_url. Trigger the set to pull in again.
                        if (bFoundOrigin == false) {
                            // No origin yet. Call the populate function
                            populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                        } else {
                            // Append sNextUrl to infinity set
                            $("#infinite-container").append('<div id="infinite-more" data-next-url="' + sNextUrl + '"><i class="fa fa-spinner fa-pulse"></i></div>');
                        }
                    }
                    
                        // Ad waypoint and handler to insert ads next to summary
                        $('.infinity-ad.empty').waypoint({
                            offset: '80%',
                            handler: function(direction) {
                                // Kill waypoint
                                this.destroy();
                                $(this.element).removeClass('empty');
                                // Create and append ad iframe. Make sure this occurs only once
                                var newIframe = infinityAd();
                                if($(this.element).children().length <= 0) {
                                    $(this.element).append(newIframe);
                                }
                            }
                        });
                    
                    // Refresh waypoints
                    Waypoint.refreshAll();
                } else {
                    // Empty asset set returned. Go back in for a real set
                    populateInfinitySet(sNextUrl);
                }
            });
        }

        // Infinite waypoint
        var waypoint = new Waypoint({
            element: document.getElementById('infinite-container'),
            handler: function(direction) {
                if (direction == 'down') {
                    if (bInfiniStop == true) {                        
                        // FINISHED. Kill the waypoint
                        this.destroy();
                    } else {
                        // Log waypoint hit event
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'infinity-scroll','action':'request', 'label':'assets requested', 'value': true});
                        var nextURL =  $('#infinite-more').data('next-url');
                        populateInfinitySet($('#infinite-more').data('next-url'));
                    }
                }
            },
            offset: 'bottom-in-view'
        });

        // Infinity ad
        function infinityAd() {
            var newIframe = document.createElement('iframe');
            newIframe.scrolling = 'no';
            newIframe.src = 'http://magicvalley.com/tncms/block/1415851/?disableTNStatsTracker=1';
            return newIframe;
        }
        // Rewrite URL to for preview
        function scrubURL(sURL) {
            if (typeof sURL != 'undefined'){
                return sURL;
            }
        }
    </script>

}

	font-weight:bold;

<div class="oht-widget oht-widget--articles" id="oht_articles_widget-10"><h2 class="widget-title"><a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/category/opinion/letters/">Letters</a></h2><div class="fat-stacks oht-article-widget__content oht-6-count"><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/make-trails-accessible/">Make trails accessible</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 1, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">It seems to me that land owner closure of snowmobile trails has been taking place at an increased rate over the past years as people buy up property and do<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/make-trails-accessible/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/tell-me-your-story-schools-debate-should-be-shared/">Tell me your story: Schools debate should be shared</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 30, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">We all have a story to tell.  Please tell me your story.  I’ll keep it in mind, I’ll hold it close, when I’m seated next to you at the next<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/tell-me-your-story-schools-debate-should-be-shared/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/our-teachers-deserve-better/">Our teachers deserve better</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 30, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">As a veteran public high school teacher, I am discouraged by Dave Younce’s response to Charles Laramie’s commentary of Nov. 4. I do not know Mr. Laramie personally but, through<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/our-teachers-deserve-better/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/think-twice-about-the-rink/">Think twice about the rink</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 30, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">We read the article on the front page of this weekend’s Rutland Herald about the Capitol Complex Commission deciding that the ice rink on the State House lawn did not<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/think-twice-about-the-rink/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/scott-made-crisis-worse/">Scott made crisis worse</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 30, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">The education funding crisis is Governor Scott’s responsibility. Whatever happened to those enticing promises he made about solving the education financing crises? That $26 million? It looks like he made<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/scott-made-crisis-worse/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/critics-seek-safety-from-ideas/">Critics seek safety from ideas</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 24, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">I find it fascinating how the people who harp on the Herald for its supposedly overwhelming leftwards lean conveniently remain silent when an oped by John McLaughry is featured in<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/critics-seek-safety-from-ideas/">...</a></p></div></div></div><div class="oht-widget oht-widget--articles" id="oht_articles_widget-16"><h2 class="widget-title"><a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/category/opinion/commentary/">Commentary</a></h2><div class="fat-stacks oht-article-widget__content oht-5-count"><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/are-we-headed-for-a-new-korean-war/">Are we headed for a new Korean War?</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | December 1, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">I f there was a message in North Korea’s launch of a new missile capable of reaching anywhere in the United States, it was that America’s strategy toward that country<a href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/are-we-headed-for-a-new-korean-war/">...</a></p></div><div class="oht-article"><h3><a class="oht-title-link" href="https://www.rutlandherald.com/articles/together-stronger/">Together, stronger</a></h3><p class="oht-article-meta" style="display: block !important;">Rutland Herald | November 30, 2017</p><p style="font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit;">As I ponder the situation that our district/ communities are facing this budget season, I know there are many of us that find ourselves questioning what is best.         var default_location = 'Rutland';
        var latlng;
        var address;
        var dist = 0;
        var Sgeocoder = (typeof google!=='undefined' && typeof google.maps!=='undefined') ? new google.maps.Geocoder() : {};

		function geodir_setup_submit_search() {
            jQuery('.geodir_submit_search').unbind('click');// unbind any other click events
			jQuery('.geodir_submit_search').click(function(e) {

                e.preventDefault();

				var s = ' ';
				var $form = jQuery(this).closest('form');

				if (jQuery("#sdist input[type='radio']:checked").length != 0) dist = jQuery("#sdist input[type='radio']:checked").val();
				if (jQuery('.search_text', $form).val() == '' || jQuery('.search_text', $form).val() == 'Search for') jQuery('.search_text', $form).val(s);
				
				// Disable location based search for disabled location post type.
				if (jQuery('.search_by_post', $form).val() != '' && typeof gd_cpt_no_location == 'function') {
					if (gd_cpt_no_location(jQuery('.search_by_post', $form).val())) {
						jQuery('.snear', $form).remove();
						jQuery('.sgeo_lat', $form).remove();
						jQuery('.sgeo_lon', $form).remove();
						jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).remove();
						jQuery($form).submit();
						return;
					}
				}
				
				if (dist > 0 || (jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]').val() == 'nearest' || jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'farthest') || (jQuery(".snear", $form).val() != '' && jQuery(".snear", $form).val() != 'Near')) {
					geodir_setsearch($form);
				} else {
					jQuery(".snear", $form).val('');
					jQuery($form).submit();
				}
			});
		}

        jQuery(document).ready(function() {
            geodir_setup_submit_search();
            //setup advanced search form on form ajax load
            jQuery("body").on("geodir_setup_search_form", function(){
                geodir_setup_submit_search();
            });
        });
        
		function geodir_setsearch($form) {
			if ((dist > 0 || (jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'nearest' || jQuery('select[name="sort_by"]', $form).val() == 'farthest')) && (jQuery(".snear", $form).val() == '' || jQuery(".snear", $form).val() == 'Near')) jQuery(".snear", $form).val(default_location);
			geocodeAddress($form);
		}

        function updateSearchPosition(latLng, $form) {
            if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(latLng.lat());
                jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(latLng.lng());
            } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(latLng.lat);
                jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(latLng.lon);
            }
            jQuery($form).submit(); // submit form after insering the lat long positions
        }

        function geocodeAddress($form) {
            // Call the geocode function
            Sgeocoder = window.gdMaps == 'google' ? new google.maps.Geocoder() : null;

            if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val() == '' || ( jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val() != '' && jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val() != ''  ) || jQuery('.snear', $form).val().match("^In:")) {
                if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val().match("^In:")) {
                    jQuery(".snear", $form).val('');
                }
                jQuery($form).submit();
            } else {
                var address = jQuery(".snear", $form).val();

                if (jQuery('.snear', $form).val() == 'Near') {
                    initialise2();
                } else {
                                        if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                        Sgeocoder.geocode({'address': address},
                            function (results, status) {
                                if (status == google.maps.GeocoderStatus.OK) {
                                    updateSearchPosition(results[0].geometry.location, $form);
                                } else {
                                    alert("Search was not successful for the following reason :" + status);
                                }
                            });
                    } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                        geocodePositionOSM(false, address, false, false, 
                            function(geo) {
                                if (typeof geo !== 'undefined' && geo.lat && geo.lon) {
                                    updateSearchPosition(geo, $form);
                                } else {
                                    alert("Search was not successful for the requested address.");
                                }
                            });
                    } else {
                        jQuery($form).submit();
                    }
                }
            }
        }

        function initialise2() {
            if (!window.gdMaps) {
                return;
            }
            
            if (window.gdMaps === 'google') {
                var latlng = new google.maps.LatLng(56.494343, -4.205446);
                var myOptions = {
                    zoom: 4,
                    mapTypeId: google.maps.MapTypeId.TERRAIN,
                    disableDefaultUI: true
                }
            } else if (window.gdMaps === 'osm') {
                var latlng = new L.LatLng(56.494343, -4.205446);
                var myOptions = {
                    zoom: 4,
                    mapTypeId: 'TERRAIN',
                    disableDefaultUI: true
                }
            }
            try { prepareGeolocation(); } catch (e) {}
            doGeolocation();
        }

        function doGeolocation() {
            if (navigator.geolocation) {
                navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(positionSuccess, positionError);
            } else {
                positionError(-1);
            }
        }

        function positionError(err) {
            var msg;
            switch (err.code) {
                case err.UNKNOWN_ERROR:
                    msg = "Unable to find your location";
                    break;
                case err.PERMISSION_DENINED:
                    msg = "Permission denied in finding your location";
                    break;
                case err.POSITION_UNAVAILABLE:
                    msg = "Your location is currently unknown";
                    break;
                case err.BREAK:
                    msg = "Attempt to find location took too long";
                    break;
                default:
                    msg = "Location detection not supported in browser";
            }
            jQuery('#info').html(msg);
        }

        function positionSuccess(position) {
            var coords = position.coords || position.coordinate || position;
            jQuery('.sgeo_lat').val(coords.latitude);
            jQuery('.sgeo_lon').val(coords.longitude);

            jQuery('.geodir-listing-search').submit();
        }

        /**

No bacteria found in tech park water; testing continues

Share Article

By Jeff Jenkins in News | October 03, 2014 at 2:39PM

SOUTH CHARLESTON, W.Va. — Officials at the West Virginia Regional Technology Park in South Charleston said Friday no bacteria was found in the park’s water system before or after flushing of the water lines.

File

The West Virginia Regional Technology Park in South Charleston is the former Dow Tech Center.

The workers and students who use the park were greeted earlier this week with signs telling them not to drink the water. It was allowed to be used to flush toilets. The signs went up after one of the tenants at the park noticed some abnormal readings while testing the water Tuesday as part of a research project. The park then did additional testing.

“The concern was that there may be the presence of bacteria but the preliminary data that we received today (Friday) indicates that it was not present in the water, which means this was an exercise in caution,” Regional Technology Park Communications Manager Kelsey Clough told MetroNews.

Not all of the tech park buildings are being used and there’s been speculation some standing water may have caused the abnormal readings. Clough said all possibilities are being checked but she didn’t want to speculate on an exact cause.

“We are looking into it to ensure that it doesn’t happen again. We are on top of it,” she said. “We are anticipating getting final results next week but until then we are offering bottled water and hand sanitizer to anyone at West Virginia Regional Technology Park.”

Kanawha Valley residents have a heightened awareness of water issues after the Jan. 9 chemical spill and water emergency on the Elk River in Charleston that contaminated water supplies for nearly 300,000 residents in parts of nine counties. Clough said that’s why the park took “proactive measures” after it learned of the abnormal readings.

Clough said there’s a lot of new activity taking place at the park and water safety is a continual conversation and “is always top of mind.”

The WVRTC is owned and operated by the state through the Higher Education Policy Commission. It’s the former Dow Chemical Tech Center. It’s the home of several technology-based tenants and the home of BridgeValley Community and Technical College.

Jeff Jenkins

<div class="entry-content-wrap" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>LAWRENCE, Ind. (WISH) — Lawrence Utilities said a boil order for its customers has been lifted as of Sunday evening.</p>
<p>The boil order was issued after a water main break Friday morning at 59th and Post. Because of the size of the water main, the system’s pressure has dropped significantly.</p>
<p>Official said Sunday at 7 p.m. that the order has been lifted.</p>
<p> </p>

	// Expando Mode: start small, then auto-resize on first click + text length
	jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).hide();
	jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).hide();

	comment.css( { 'height':'10px' } ).one( 'focus', function() {
		var timer = setInterval( HighlanderComments.resizeCallback, 10 )
		jQuery( this ).animate( { 'height': HighlanderComments.initialHeight } ).delay( 100 ).queue( function(n) { clearInterval( timer ); HighlanderComments.resizeCallback(); n(); } );
		jQuery( '#comment-form-identity' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#comment-form-subscribe' ).slideDown();
		jQuery( '#commentform .form-submit' ).slideDown();
	});
}
jQuery(document).ready( highlander_expando_javascript );

<div class="asset-content subscriber-premium" itemprop="articleBody">
<p>BLACK BROOK — A boil-water order is in place for Black Brook Water District #1, on Silver Lake Road from the Catholic cemetery to the end of the district.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_top"></div><p>Loss of pressure due to a water-line break necessitated the order, according to a notice from the Clinton County Health Department.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_middle"><div class="tncms-block visible-xs" id="tncms-block-1108091">
<!-- Mobile Rectangle ATF 300x250 article -->
<div class="visible-xs visible-sm" id="mobileRectangle_atf" style="width:100%;text-align:center">
<script type="text/javascript">
AdBridg.cmd.push(function() { AdBridg.display('mobileRectangle_atf'); });
</script>
</div>
<div class="clear" style="padding-bottom:10px"></div>
</div></div>
<p>Users must boil a water used for drinking and culinary purposes for one minute then let it cool or use bottled water.</p><div class="tncms-region hidden-print" id="tncms-region-article_instory_bottom"></div>
</div>

        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            var bThrottle = false;
            var $region = $('#tncms-region-asset_side_sticky');

            if (
                $region.is(':empty') === false &&
                $('.main-sidebar').height() + $(window).height() < $('.main-content').height() &&
                window.innerWidth >= 992
            ) {
                var $tempRegion = $('<div id="asset_side_sticky-placeholder"></div>');
                $region.before($tempRegion);
                $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );

                $(window).on('scroll mousewheel', function(){
                    if( bThrottle === false ){
                        bThrottle = true;

                        setTimeout(function(){
                            var iFixPoint = $region.offset().top - 30;
                            var iCurPoint = $(this).scrollTop();

                            if (iCurPoint < $tempRegion.offset().top - 30) {
                                $region.css('top', null);
                                $region.removeClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else if (
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#infinite-container') ||
                                __tnt.elementOnScreen('#site-footer-container')
                            ) {
                                $region.removeClass('affix')
                                $region.addClass('affix-bottom');

                            } else {
                                $region.css('top', 30);
                                $region.addClass('affix');
                                $region.removeClass('affix-bottom');
                            }
                            bThrottle = false;
                        }, 25);
                    }
                });

                $(window).on('resize', function(){
                    $region.width( $tempRegion.width() );
                });
            }
        });
    </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
        jQuery(document).ready(function($){
            // Reset the meter if the data store is too old.
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking reset date");

    var expireDate = new Date(__tnt.metering.config.date);
    var lastDate = new Date(__tnt.recent.date.get());
    
    expireDate = expireDate.getTime();
    lastDate = lastDate.getTime();
    
    if(Number(lastDate)<Number(expireDate)){
        __tnt.log("resetting restrictions");
        var nextDate = new Date(expireDate+(__tnt.metering.config.days * 86400000));

        __tnt.recent.count.set(0);
        __tnt.recent.date.set(nextDate.getTime());

        __tnt.log(nextDate);
    }
});

// Set the 'read' variable if the current asset is in the recent assets list
__tnt.metering.init.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("checking whether user has read this before");
    
    var recent = __tnt.recent.assets.get();
    var uuid = __tnt.metering.config.uuid;
    
    var check = false;
    var i = 0;
    while(!check && i < recent.length){
        if(recent[i]==uuid){
            __tnt.log("found asset in recent");
            var check = true;
        }
        i++;
    }    
    
    if(check){
        __tnt.log("user has read this already");
        __tnt.metering.config.read = true;
    }else{
        __tnt.log("not read before");
    }
});
// if count is less than registration limit return true
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if(__tnt.recent.count.get()<__tnt.metering.config.reg_limit){
        return true;
    }
});
// check if the user is known and then test against the subscription limit
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if((__tnt.user.loggedIn)&&(__tnt.recent.count.get()<__tnt.metering.config.sub_limit)){
        return true;
    }
});
// if the user has read this asset before they can read the asset
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("user has previously viewed asset");
        return true;
    }
});
// Allows a user arriving from a listed site to bypass any restrictions and access the site
__tnt.metering.access.c.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("Checking referrer to see if the user arrived from a permitted site.");
            
    var sites = ['lm.facebook.com','l.facebook.com','m.facebook.com','news.google.com','news.yahoo.com','facebook.com','twitter.com','t.co','fb.me','plus.google.com','goo.gl','google.com','yahoo.com','drudgereport.com','paid.outbrain.com','rma-api.gravity.com','fark.com','bing.com','tpc.googlesyndication.com','msn.com','reddit.com','hsrd.yahoo.com','aol.com','idrudgereport.com','search.tb.ask.com','aol.com'];
    
    var cleanedReferrer = String(String(window.document.referrer).split('?')[0]).replace(/https\:\/\/|http\:\/\//,'').replace(/www/,'');
    var check = false;
    
    $.each(sites,function(){
        var regexp = String(this).replace(/\./g,'\\.').replace(/\,/g,'|');
    
        if(String(cleanedReferrer).search(regexp)>-1){
            __tnt.log("User arrived from site, entry granted");
        
            check = true;
        }else{
        	__tnt.log("User arrived from other site, no special access");
        }
    });
    
    __tnt.metering.config.referred = check;
    return check;
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    __tnt.log("executing granted scripts");
    // Analytics logging goes here
    if(window.ga){
        if(__tnt.metering.config.read){
            // log read
            __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'previously read','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
        }else{
            // log new view
            if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){
                __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'under subscription limit','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});

                if(window.sessionStorage){
                    if(sessionStorage.getItem('__tnt.metering.wall.registration')){
                        __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'wall action','label':'logged in after encountering wall','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
                    }

                    sessionStorage.removeItem('__tnt.metering.wall.registration');
                }
            }else{
                __tnt.trackEvent({'category':'tnt-metering','action':'free view','label':'under registration limit','value':Number(__tnt.recent.count.get())});
            }

        }
    }
});
// increment counter on new assets
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    // this will also need to check if the user has previously read the asset (by checking the swtich set by the init script.)
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.log("incrementing counter");

        var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
        count++;
        __tnt.recent.count.set(count);

        // fire an event that will allow a one time only message for a given count
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.new');
    }else{
        $(window).trigger('__tnt.metering.read');
    }
});
// add unread assets to the recent asset list
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    if(!__tnt.metering.config.read){
        __tnt.recent.assets.add(__tnt.metering.config.uuid);
    }
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){$('.subscriber-hide').show();
});
__tnt.metering.access.e.push(function(){
    var count = __tnt.recent.count.get();
    var limit = __tnt.metering.config.sub_limit;
    var remaining = (limit - count);

    if(count > limit){count = limit;}
    if(remaining < 0){remaining = 0;}

    var messageClass = 'access';
    if(__tnt.metering.config.referred){ messageClass = 'referred'; }
    if(__tnt.metering.config.read){ messageClass = 'read'; }

    var message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=false]').first();
    if(__tnt.user.loggedIn){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+'][data-registered=true]').first(); }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-count='+count+']').first(); }

    if(!message.length && window.sessionStorage){
        if(sessionStorage.getItem('__tnt.metering.wall.viewed')=="1"){
            message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+'[data-registered=true][data-after-wall=true]').first();
        }
    }

    if(!message.length){ message = $('#template-metering').find('.template.meter.'+messageClass+':not([data-count]):not([data-after-wall])').first(); }

    if(message.length){
        __tnt.template(
            message,
            $('#asset-content').find('.asset-body'),
            true,
            [{
                'element': '.count',
                'html': count
            },{
                'element': '.total',
                'html': limit
            },{
                'element': '.remaining',
                'html': remaining
            }]
        );
    }

    if(__tnt.user.authToken){
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.logged-in').show();
    }else{
        $('#asset-content').find('.meter.notification').find('.not-logged-in').show();
